Key Match Events: Cole Anthony scored 24 points, Wendell Carter Jr. had a season-high 19 off the bench.
The Magic limited the Knicks to 4-for-22 shooting from 3-point range and didn't allow a make in the second half until Cam Payne's basket with 8.2 seconds remaining.
Jalen Brunson and Mikal Bridges each scored 24 points for the Knicks.
The Knicks were held to their lowest point total of the season in their season-high third straight loss.
The Magic outscored the Knicks 50-18 in bench points.

The Knicks scored four straight points to get within six, then won a challenge to overturn a foul that was called on Josh Hart and get the ball back. But they didn't score, and Caldwell-Pope and Carter made 3s in a 7-2 spurt that pushed it to 95-84 with 3:05 remaining.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Orlando avoided a four-game sweep by winning the final meeting, keeping the lead in the all-time series at 68-66.
